author: Special Correspondent
text:
The association representing candidates who had passed the National Eligibility Test and the State Eligibility Test have petitioned the Chief Minister’s cell for a probe into teacher appointments in the last 10 years.

The test is a requirement for appointment as teachers in colleges and universities.

The NET/SLET Association, with around 50,000 members, has said they have no confidence in the current recruitment process. At present, the Teachers Recruitment Board (TRB) directly appoints teachers based on educational certificates they produce. “We fear large-scale violations in appointments. The certificates of all teachers recruited in the last 10 years should be scrutinised for genuineness,” said association president R. Thangamuniandi. “Not even four per cent of NET/SET qualified persons have got jobs through TRB,” he alleged.
title: Probe into teacher appointments sought
